intro: Robinsonia evenia, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Robinsonia evenia is often found in alpine meadows and is a characteristic species of its habitat.
